title: Drawing, 1911-28-231, ca. 1714
medium: Pen, with brush, brown, black and red ink, graphite on two sheets of joined cream laid paper
markings: Cluster of grapes and lily over I - C.
inscribed: In brown ink, at lower right:" O" [and vertical scale, given in pieds]. At right, vertically, in brown ink: "72 hauter de la grande glacee/ Syl'on l'an...(?) aux deux Trammeaux de mettre les/ joins de la autre (?) glace à meme hauteur comme il est du/ raison les de(ux) glace porl...(?) 80 pouce sur 53 pouce.
provenance: From the collection of Léon Decloux, Paris
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The left half of a fireplace wall, showing the mirror frame, terminates in a volute. Within the mirror area, a reduced, similar scheme is depicted. A vertical carved panel with a figure of Fame and a fountain below is at left. Both chimneywalls are decorated with carved ornaments and foliage. This is probably an alternate design for those published in Livre de Differentes Decorations d'Apartements, Suite SS.

exhibitions.title: The Art of Decoration: Drawings and Objects from the Collection of the Cooper-Hewitt Museum
